description: The first incarnation of the Doctor was portrayed by William Hartnell. During Hartnell's tenure, the episodes were a mixture of stories set on Earth of the future with extraterrestrial influence, on alien planets, and in historical events without extraterrestrial influence, such as Marco Polo, one of the lost serials. In his last story, The Tenth Planet, the Doctor gradually grew weaker to the point of collapsing at the end of the fourth episode, leading to his regeneration.

episodes.description: The Doctor and his companions arrive in prehistoric Earth and get involved with a tribe struggling to make fire.

episodes.title: An Unearthly Child
episodes.written_by: Anthony Coburn and C. E. Webber (uncredited)

episodes.description: The TARDIS crew lands on a dead planet and discovers the Daleks, who have survived a war with the Thals.
The TARDIS malfunctions and the crew members suspect each other of sabotage.
The TARDIS crew joins Marco Polo on his journey across 13th century China.
The Doctor and his companions search for the keys to the Conscience of Marinus.
The TARDIS lands in Mexico during the time of the Aztecs. Barbara is mistaken for a goddess.
The TARDIS crew encounters the Sensorites, an alien race that can read minds.
The TARDIS crew arrives in France during the French Revolution.
The TARDIS crew is miniaturized and must stop a deadly pesticide from being released.
The Daleks invade Earth and the TARDIS crew must stop them.
The Doctor and his companions land on Dido and encounter a young girl named Vicki.
The TARDIS crew is caught in the intrigues of the Roman Empire.
The TARDIS is captured by the Zarbi on the planet Vortis.
The Doctor and his companions find themselves caught in the midst of the Crusades.
The TARDIS crew becomes exhibits in a futuristic museum.
The Daleks pursue the TARDIS across time and space.
The Doctor encounters another Time Lord, the Monk, who is meddling with history.
The Doctor and his companions land on a planet where two races, the Drahvins and the Rills, are at war.
A standalone episode featuring the Daleks plotting their invasion of the solar system.
The Doctor and his companions become involved in the events of the Trojan War.
The Daleks have a master plan to conquer the universe, and the Doctor must stop them.
The Doctor and Steven arrive in Paris during the St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre.
The Doctor and his companions discover a human colony on a spaceship controlled by the Monoids.
The Doctor faces the Celestial Toymaker, who forces him to play deadly games.
The Doctor and his companions get involved in the gunfight at the O.K. Corral.
The Doctor and his companions discover a society where the Elders drain life energy from the Savages.
The Doctor must stop the War Machines, supercomputers that plan to conquer humanity.
The TARDIS lands in 17th century Cornwall, where the Doctor and his companions become embroiled in a smuggling ring.
The Doctor and his companions face the Cybermen for the first time at the South Pole.
